formattedAddress: 500 W 145th St, New York, NY 10031, USA
adrFormatAddress: 500 W 145th St, New York, NY 10031, USA

editorialSummary.text: Unique cocktails & seasonal comfort food served in cozy digs with wood paneling & a chill vibe.

originalText.text: DO NOT COME HERE. We paid for a babyshower event. Luis overcharged us for services we did not receive. We paid all the money before the event. When we got to the place to decorate.. place was dirty and smelled bad. We had to deep clean and move furniture ourselves. Sink was broken.. water leaked all over the place! Our agreement was from 1-9pm. Around 6pm he was being rude and started overwhelming us and the guest insisting for us to leave the place on time. He kept complaining to us and made us feel uncomfortable. He also had people who weren’t guest at the event come in and out the business. Around 8pm family started to  pick up and leave. We stayed to clean the whole place and put everything back how it was. This was such a headache and a horrible experience. I need half of my money refunded.

originalText.text: Amazing cute place for small group or private party, a good place for couples, families, amazing drinks and food cooked for you.

text.text: Amazing cute place for small group or private party, a good place for couples, families, amazing drinks and food cooked for you.

originalText.text: Yay! Love having a nutritious juice bar in the neighborhood. Family-owned place serving complete fresh juice and smoothie menu + food + alcoholic beverages. Friendly service! Will be a regular stop.

text.text: Yay! Love having a nutritious juice bar in the neighborhood. Family-owned place serving complete fresh juice and smoothie menu + food + alcoholic beverages. Friendly service! Will be a regular stop.

originalText.text: Food for dine-in is not bad. But don’t rent the space and have them cater your party. I did that for my birthday and Luis charged me a lot of money for terrible service/execution and food handling. We planned 2 months in advance and met weekly and then daily until the event; agreed on the food, drinks, bartender, servers and space setup. My guests and I arrived with the space not set up properly. My friends and I had to move some of the furniture ourselves. We were missing chairs and tables. The bartender didn’t arrive until 40 minutes after my guests arrived. There were no servers. One of my guests started serving drinks because everyone was standing by the bar waiting. The food service started late. Half of my guests didn’t get their plated food until 2-3 hours later. They were already too drunk to eat. I was so embarrassed and had to apologize to all my guests. I also caught Luis in the kitchen reusing some of the leftover food and re-serving them to the other guests. I told him to stop it immediately, and that it was wrong and a health risk. I didn’t want  my guests to get sick. And most importantly, I paid for food enough to serve my guests and more. There’s no reason to run out of food. I should have reported him to the Department of Health for doing that and sued him. He was a bad planner and a con man for charging me a lot of money.  He wanted all the money before the event started. He said he had to pay someone. I trusted him and gave him the money. I should have held back half of the money until the end of the event. My friends and I saved what was a disastrous event service and execution by Luis. Only eat here for dine-in. Or if you want to rent the space, have it catered by another place or bring the food yourself. Don’t give him the money until he delivers per your agreement.

originalText.text: One of the best kept secret of Washington heights! You need to come to this place and have their amazing cocktails and food! They are open late and is just a chilled vibe. You can smoke hooka and bud if you have some with you. This place is lit!
